description: Hugo & LÃ©a act as requirements engineers for this project[cite: 1].
Native macOS development with Universal Binary support (Apple Silicon/Intel)[cite: 9, 76].
Swift/SwiftUI usage for a lightweight footprint without external dependencies[cite: 78, 79].
Key concepts definition: Sequential Copying and Floating Pins[cite: 2, 5].
Integration via Menu Bar icon, System Shelf, and Background Agent[cite: 49, 50, 51].
Support for macOS 12.0+ and Accessibility/Screen Recording permissions[cite: 74, 77].
Global hotkeys must function across QWERTY, AZERTY, and QWERTZ layouts[cite: 89].
Target active RAM consumption between 100MB and 300MB[cite: 70].
Transform the volatile system clipboard into a structured and searchable workspace[cite: 1].
Elimination of context-switching and reduction of cognitive load[cite: 2, 64].
Handling of Text, Code, Media, Files, and Links with metadata[cite: 4, 20].
Local-only storage: no cloud synchronization of data[cite: 18, 99, 100].
No support for Right-to-Left (RTL) languages at launch[cite: 90].
No support for third-party plugins or extensions at launch[cite: 97].
Target users: developers, writers, and researchers[cite: 16, 64].
Horizontal "Shelf" interface limited to 35% of screen height[cite: 45, 50].
Card-based history list featuring source application icons[cite: 45, 67].
Smart preview pane (code rendering, images, rich links)[cite: 46].
Real-time multi-parameter search and filtering by tags[cite: 12, 40].
Full CRUD lifecycle for tags with protection against auto-purge[cite: 6, 35, 38].
Temporary FIFO stack for Sequential Copying (CMD+SHIFT+C)[cite: 5, 26].
Detachable, resizable "Floating Pins" windows that stay Always-on-Top[cite: 11, 30, 31].
Deep Awareness integration with browsers, IDEs, and design tools[cite: 17, 93].
Instantaneous response times: Capture <10ms, Search <100ms, UI <150ms[cite: 15, 54, 55, 58].
AES-256 encryption at rest and exclusion of concealed sensitive data[cite: 7, 59, 60].
Local backup system via daily snapshots and manual export[cite: 103, 104].
